title: How to Make a Homemade Low Fat Hamburger

steps.headline: Put the onion, ground beef, ground bread crumbs, egg, and one teaspoon of each seasoning in a container.
steps.description: Mix all with your hand, and squeeze them very well. Cover and place them in your fridge  overnight. You can add more seasoning if you prefer, but be careful not to use too much salt.

steps.headline: Cover the container with plastic wrap.
steps.description:
Then, form the hamburger. Take a handful of mixed meat and flatten on plastic wrap. Place a container as shown below in the picture. Twist container a few times until you form the hamburger. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Collect the excess of meat around the circle and wrap the hamburger.
steps.description: Do this procedure until you run out of hamburger. Place all hamburgers on a small plate.

steps.headline: Put all prepared hamburgers in your freezer for future use.
Turn on the oven on maximum level.
steps.description: Let heat for a few minutes, then place the hamburger in the oven. It takes about 20 minutes until it gets cooked completely.

steps.headline: Put the hamburger on a hamburger bun.
steps.description: You can purchase them from a local supermarket.

text:
Preparing Put the onion, ground beef, ground bread crumbs, egg, and one teaspoon of each seasoning in a container. Mix all with your hand, and squeeze them very well. Cover and place them in your fridge overnight. You can add more seasoning if you prefer, but be careful not to use too much salt. Cover the container with plastic wrap. Then, form the hamburger. Take a handful of mixed meat and flatten on plastic wrap. Place a container as shown below in the picture. Twist container a few times until you form the hamburger. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} This is what the hamburger should look like after. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c1\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c1\/Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Homemade-Low-Fat-Hamburger-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Collect the excess of meat around the circle and wrap the hamburger. Do this procedure until you run out of hamburger. Place all hamburgers on a small plate. Put all prepared hamburgers in your freezer for future use. Making Turn on the oven on maximum level. Let heat for a few minutes, then place the hamburger in the oven. It takes about 20 minutes until it gets cooked completely. Put the hamburger on a hamburger bun. You can purchase them from a local supermarket. Put on toppings if desired. Serve.
